talk.author: did:plc:kaadgatf6opidxgwmg34ewr4
talk.utter: They merged politics with religion, where facts have never mattered.

talk.author: did:plc:jcfykltjsugz4jylflr4vlft
talk.utter: Politics have always been merged with religion... based in it actually.

talk.author: did:plc:kaadgatf6opidxgwmg34ewr4
talk.utter: Not in the United States, though conservatives have always wanted it that way.

talk.author: did:plc:kaadgatf6opidxgwmg34ewr4
talk.utter: Not in the United States, though conservatives have always wanted it that way.

talk.author: did:plc:jcfykltjsugz4jylflr4vlft
talk.utter:
Read our founding documents .. read The Federalist Papers ... 

Now, don't get me twisted. You can practice or not practice any religion you want. 

Being based in religion does not equal having a mandatory religion

talk.author: did:plc:kaadgatf6opidxgwmg34ewr4
talk.utter: Founding fathers being religious does not equal government being based in religion, and the constitution is pretty explicit about that.
